group_1.textRight: You're quite skilled.

group_1.textLeft: Huh?

group_1.textRight: At dancing. Such lovely, elegant footwork,@I must say.

group_1.textLeft: ...N-no. Honestly, I'm just following your lead,@Tsukihiko.

group_1.textRight: Me? Oh, I was an absolute disaster starting out,@I assure you.
Only natural, considering I spent my whole youth@serving in apprenticeships.

group_1.textLeft: Really?

group_1.textRight: Mm-hm. Tripped over my own feet, went tumbling@onto the floor, wound up with a black eye.

group_1.textLeft: Oh my...!

group_1.textRight: Shall I demonstrate?

group_1.textLeft: P-please don't.

group_1.textRight: Haha! I kid, I kid.

group_1.textLeft: ...It's so strange.
Up until just a moment ago...
All I could think about was how to escape from this@marriage my parents arranged.
...That was the only thing on my mind.

group_1.textRight: Hm.@And... as for now?

group_1.textLeft: I wish this moment could go on forever...
...That's all I care about right now.
Ohâ€” I'm so sorry. I didn't...

group_1.textRight: No, no, think nothing of it.
...Honestly, I've been feeling the exact same way.

group_1.textCenter: Well done, everyone.@That should do it for today's scene!

group_1.textRight: Whew...

group_1.textLeft: Ahhh, that was nerve-wracking!
Hooray! You all did great!

group_1.textRight: I'm quite surprised, too.@Everyone was completely absorbed in their role.
To think that you had such an unexpected side to@you, Komachi...
Hey, hey. Try not to confuse the actor with her@performance, alright?

group_1.textLeft: I gave you the best acting instruction I could, after@all. "C'mon! Really BECOME Tsukihiko!"

group_1.textRight: Anyway... Mihono, you can put it back to daytime@now.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, right!

group_1.textRight: It's noon again...!
And it got really dark all of a sudden right before@filming, right?
What the heck kind of setup did you guys put@together?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, that! As a matter of fact, it's my magic at work.
I made a film-related wish when I became a@Magical Girl.
So it seems like I can use...@stage direction magic, I suppose?
Creating effects to liven up a drama, essentially.

group_1.textRight: What sort of stuff does that include?

group_1.textLeft: Well, it's nothing particularly dramatic, just so you@know.
In this case, for instance, I only made it look dark@through the windows on our end.
It was still noon outside!

group_1.textRight: I see~.
The room really does look pretty, though!
It's just like a real old mansion.

group_1.textLeft: As a matter of fact, it IS real.
This is the very place where Tsukihiko and Ruri@met for the first time!

group_1.textRight: Seriously?!

group_1.textLeft: Nowadays it's a museum, though.

group_1.textRight: ...It was really just a coincidence.
But Mihono said she'd pinned down a good-looking@mansion, and when we came to see it...
...it turned out to be the actual Taisho-era mansion@that Tsukihiko built.

group_1.textLeft: And the old news article that led us to adapt this@story...
...was something I found in this same museum, too.

group_1.textRight: Sometimes things just line up.
| Was it really a coincidence? |
| Perhaps Seira's stage-direction magic led you to@the perfect filming location. |

group_1.textLeft: ...My magic?

group_1.textRight: | Nemu told me about it once. |
| Some girls have magic that takes effect without@them realizing. |
...Interesting.

group_1.textLeft: Well, background info aside.
Let's all keep up the good work on the production!

group_1.textRight: Yeah! And soon, the Historical Research Club's...
...Y'know, it's kind of hard to talk about a movie that@still doesn't have a title.
Got any ideas, Mihono?

group_1.textLeft: No...@what about you, Kira-sensei?

group_1.textRight: ...I'll think about it.
